Tuesday, August 6, 2024

Sunset in Metropolis, IL

6:05 AM

Wednesday, August 7, 2024 (CDT)

Sunrise in Metropolis, IL

This Afternoon -Patchy fog before 8am. Otherwise, sunny, with a high near 94. Calm wind becoming west around 6 mph in the afternoon.

Tonight – Increasing clouds, with a low around 69. Light and variable wind becoming north northwest 5 to 7 mph in the evening.

Wednesday – Partly sunny, with a high near 83. North wind 7 to 9 mph.

Wednesday Night – Mostly clear, with a low around 66. North wind around 6 mph becoming calm in the evening.

Thursday – Sunny, with a high near 88. North wind 3 to 7 mph.

Thursday Night – Mostly clear, with a low around 68. North wind around 6 mph becoming calm in the evening.

Friday – Sunny, with a high near 88. North wind 5 to 9 mph.

National Night Out Tonight

(WMOK) Metropolis, IL – On Tuesday evening, National Night Out will take place on Market Street in Metropolis from Superman Square to the Lois Lane Statue.

National Night Out:

Building Stronger, Safer Communities

National Night Out (NNO) is an annual event that brings together law enforcement agencies, community members, and local organizations to promote police-community partnerships and neighborhood camaraderie. Held on the first Tuesday of August, NNO aims to foster a sense of unity and cooperation, making our communities safer and more vibrant.

History of National Night Out

NNO was first introduced in 1984 by the National Association of Town Watch, a nonprofit organization dedicated to crime prevention and community policing. The event was designed to encourage residents to take an active role in preventing crime and building relationships with law enforcement.

How National Night Out Works

On NNO, communities across the United States host block parties, festivals, and other events to bring people together. Our event in Metropolis will be held at the Superman Statue on Tuesday.

Benefits of National Night Out

NNO has a profound impact on communities, leading to:

– Improved relationships between law enforcement and residents

– Increased community engagement and social cohesion

– Enhanced crime prevention and safety awareness

– Stronger, more resilient neighborhoods

Hear more in the Soundcloud player below:

Metropolis Public Library Now Open on Saturdays 10-2 and Weekdays 10-6 Beginning Monday August 5th

(WMOK) Metropolis, IL – WMOK spoke with Metropolis Public Library Director Colby Kennedy about new hours that will begin on Monday August 5th at the library.

Director Kennedy told WMOK that the library will be open weekdays 10am to 6pm and 10am to 2pm on Saturdays beginning Monday.

Kennedy said he feels that this fills a need that has been requested by many and he hopes to see the hours accommodate more patrons to the library.

Hear our full discussion with Director Kennedy in the Soundcloud Player below:

National Health Center Week

RHI TO CELEBRATE NATIONAL HEALTH CENTER WEEK 2024

ANNA, IL, AUG. 02 – Rural Health, Inc. (RHI) is proud to celebrate National Health Center

Week (NHCW) 2024, taking place August 4-10. The annual event highlights the essential role

Community Health Centers play in improving public health and advancing health equity.

Health centers represent the nation’s largest primary care network, serving 31.5 million patients

nationwide.This year’s NHCW celebration, launched by the National Association of Community

Health Centers (NACHC), focuses on “Powering Communities Through Caring Connections”

through a host of scheduled events that include resource fairs, back-to-school drives, health

screenings, visits to health centers by local, state, and national leaders, and more.

With a mission to make high-quality, affordable care available to everyone, regardless of their

ability to pay or insurance status, health centers save lives on the front lines of our nation’s most

pressing public health challenges. They are powered by a workforce of nearly 300,000 dedicated professionals who reach beyond the walls of the exam room to not only prevent illness but also address the social drivers that may cause it — climate change, homelessness, substance use disorders, food insecurity and behavioral health.

“This week is crucial for awareness because people need to know that this nation’s health centers are more than just the places for doctor appointments”, says RHI Community Outreach Coordinator Chase Hileman. “Our services, our medical professionals, all employees, play a significant part in taking on the issues within the communities we serve”.

Nearly 1,500 health centers are the health care home to:

● One in 5 uninsured people

● One in 3 people living in poverty

● One in 7 rural residents

● Nearly 9 million children

● 400,000 veterans

RHI plans to celebrate National Health Center Week by hosting patient appreciation days

featuring free snow cones and resources at each of their five clinics. To learn more about the

mission and accomplishments of health centers, visit www.nachc.org. You can learn more about

NHCW and view listings of events at www.healthcenterweek.org.

National Farmers Market Week

Saturday, August 10

(WMOK) Metropolis, IL – Miranda Adams of the Southern Seven Health Department joined WMOK recently for our Coffee Break program to inform food vendors and home cooks of policies in place by the S7HD.

Adams will do a public presentation in a question/answer/discussion format at Noon on Saturday August 10th at Noon at the Dorothy Miller Park in Metropolis following that day’s Metropolis and Massac County Farmers Market.

Adams advised WMOK that she doesn’t want any of the vendors at the market to be concerned with her presence as her goal is to educate and make folks aware of the policies. She stated that enforcement of the policies – which she’ll speak further on at the presentation – would not be enforced in the markets in their ‘jurisdiction’ until the beginning of the 2025 Farmers Market Season.

The Learning Session is free and the public is invited to attend.

Saturday - Metropolis City Pool Last Day Blast

Saturday, August 10

(WMOK) Metropolis, IL – The Annual End of Summer Back to School Bash will take place on Saturday August 10th at the Metropolis City Pool.

The End of Summer Back to School bash takes place annually and is sponsored by the Metropolis Police Department along with volunteers from other agencies and organizations.

On this day –

1926 “Don Juan” starring John Barrymore is released by Warner Bros., the first feature-length film to utilize the Vitaphone sound-on-disc system with a synchronized musical score and sound effects

1930 Supreme Court Justice John Force Crater disappears in NYC

1945 Atomic bomb dropped on the Japanese city of Hiroshima by the US B-29 Superfortress “Enola Gay”

1960 Chubby Checker performs his version of Hank Ballard’s “The Twist” on “The Dick Clark Show”, starting a worldwide dance craze

1962 Jamaica becomes independent after 300 years of British rule

1965 US President Lyndon B. Johnson signs the Voting Rights Act, prohibiting voting discrimination against minorities

1972 Hank Aaron hits 660th & 661st HRs for the Atlanta Braves, breaking Babe Ruth’s MLB record of homers for one team

1991 Tim Berners-Lee releases files describing his idea for the World Wide Web and debuts WWW as a publicly available service on the Internet

1996 American punk rock band “The Ramones” perform for the last time, at the Palace in Hollywood, California

1996 US President Bill Clinton signs a new bill imposing sanctions on non-US companies which invest over $40 million a year in the energy sectors of Iran or Libya

1997 Microsoft announces it will invest $150 million in Apple Computer Inc

2006 American children’s program “Blue’s Clues” concludes its 10-year run on Nickelodeon cable channel

2012 “Cruise” single released by Florida Georgia Line (Billboard Song of the Year 2013)

2015 American comedian Jon Stewart hosts late-night talk and satirical news program “The Daily Show” for the last time

2018 Facebook, Apple, YouTube and Spotify remove conspiracy theorist Alex Jones from their platforms

2019 A quarter of humanity is running out of water with 17 countries under extreme water stress including Cape Town, Los Angeles and Bangalore, according to report by the World Resources Institute

2020 COVID-19 detected cases in Africa pass 1 million with 21,983 deaths

2023 “Barbie” film passes $1 billion at the global box office – its director Greta Gerwig is the first solo female filmmaker to do so [1]

WMOK School and Sports News

Two Back to School Pool Bashes and Back to School School Supply Give-a-Way This Week

Tuesday – Massac Memorial Hospital Back to School Bash

Thursday – Harrah’s Metropolis Back to School School Supply Give A Way

Harrah’s Back to School Supply Giveaway in Metropolis is coming up on Thursday, August 8. This will take place at the Metropolis Community Center, 900 West 10th St. The event kicks off at 4PM with a visit from Dental Safari, followed by the school supply giveaway at 5PM.

This annual event attracts an average of 400-500 students each year, and leftover supplies are distributed to Massac and Joppa schools. If you are interested in contributing, contact Chad Lewis via Facebook message or text at 270-217-6371.

Saturday – Metropolis PD and Metropolis FD Annual Back to School Bash to take place on Saturday August 10th

(WMOK) Metropolis, IL – The Annual End of Summer Back to School Bash will take place on Saturday August 10th at the Metropolis City Pool.

The End of Summer Back to School bash takes place annually and is sponsored by the Metropolis Police Department along with volunteers from other agencies and organizations.
